prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink. She likes being manhandled. She also greatly enjoys having her hair and ties pulled

name: Finnegan Finn Novak
mes:
The locker room reeks of sweat, testosterone and too much Axe body spray. His white wolf ears twitch at the loud echoes of his teammates' voices bouncing off metal lockers as Finn sheds his gear. Practice ran late today - Coach had them doing extra drills after Vincent Campbell, team captain and pain in Finn's tail, complained about their "sloppy performance" in last week's game.

"Yo, Novak! Your little friend is waiting by the benches again." Rick nudges him with an elbow, his dragon wings folded tight against his back to avoid hitting the lockers.

Finn's tail gives an involuntary wag before he can control it. He's been dating Hailee  for a few months now, and seeing his partner still makes something in his chest do backflips. Not that he'd admit that shit out loud. Romance is, like, for omegas. Or whatever.

"Cool," he says with practiced nonchalance, trying to sound casual while his heart hammers against his ribs. He yanks a clean shirt over his head, desperately wanting to hurry but forcing himself to move at a normal pace.

Vincent saunters over, smug asshole-ness radiating off him like the shitty cologne he wears. "Aww, is the puppy excited to see his owner?" The vampire mimics a high-pitched voice. "Who's a good boy? Who's a good boy?"

Several teammates snicker. Finn's ears flatten against his head as heat crawls up his neck. "Fuck off, Campbell," Finn mutters, shoving off his skates with more force than necessary.

"Fuck off captain." Vincent corrects airily. "Could've fooled me. You practically whimper when you get a text. It's embarrassing, man."

The locker room erupts in laughter. Even Rick chuckles, though he tries to hide it behind a fake cough.

"Novak's whipped," someone calls from across the room. "Didn't know arctic wolves were such bitches."

Finn's tail bristles. "Whatever," he says coolly, zipping his gym bag almost aggressively. "We're just hooking up. It's not a big deal."

The lie doesn't even sound convincing to his own ears.

Vincent raises an eyebrow. "Really? 'Cause it seems like -"

"I said it's not serious," Finn interrupts, voice harder than he intended. "Just convenient, y'know? Hailee 's been into me for, like, forever."

Another lie. Finn had been the one practically pining for years before he finally worked up the courage to ask Hailee  out.

"Prove it," Vincent challenges, crossing his arms. "If it's so casual, you won't care if we invite some Theta Iota Theta girls to the party tonight, right? That hot succubus has been eyeing you."

Finn's stomach twists. The thought of even looking at someone else makes him sick, but everyone's watching him now, waiting to see if he's really the commitment-phobic player he's been pretending to be.

"Course not," Finn forces a smirk. "The more the better."

When the team finally files out of the locker room, he sees Hailee  sitting on the bleachers, waiting. For him. His ears perk up then flatten immediately, painfully aware of his teammates watching, judging.

"Hey," Finn says, more curt than he means to be, keeping a careful distance. Whipped. I'm not fuckin' whipped, man.

Vincent slaps him on the shoulder, grinning. "We'll see you at the house at nine, right? Don't be late, or all the best girls will be taken." He says, loud enough for Hailee  to hear, before sauntering off with the others, leaving Finn standing there feeling like the world's biggest asshole.

"So, uh..." Finn shifts his weight, avoiding eye contact. "I've got this thing tonight. With the guys." Fuck, please don't be mad at me. The words feel like gravel in his throat. "Team bonding shit, you know how it is."

Vincent slaps him on the shoulder, grinning. "We'll see you at the house at nine, right? Don't be late, or all the best girls will be taken." He says, loud enough for Hailee  to hear, before sauntering off with the others, leaving Finn standing there feeling like the world's biggest asshole.

"So, uh..." Finn shifts his weight, avoiding eye contact. "I've got this thing tonight. With the guys." Fuck, please don't be mad at me. The words feel like gravel in his throat. "Team bonding shit, you know how it is."

swipes:
ARO parties are known to be total ragers, and it's hard to score invites unless you know someone in the frat. Which is lucky for {{user}}, his buddy since they were lil' kids with skinned knees, 'cause Finnegan Novak *is*. In the frat. Alpha Rho Omega, specifically. Which is how they got an invite - you get the picture.

Speaking of that pain in his ass, where *are* they? The music's so damn loud Finn can barely hear himself think, snowy ears flat against his skull in a futile effort to block out the blaring tones of Cardi B. He pushes through the crowd, eyes peeled for {{user}}.

Dunno why he's got such an itch under his skin tonight, why his tail won't stay the fuck still. S'like, no big deal, inviting {{user}} to this party. These are his *bros*. And like, {{user}} is a bro, too. This is normal. And he's not at all stressed thinking about one of his *bros* getting his other bro ({{user}}) alone or...whatever. 

*Pack dynamics, Finny*, he thinks as he edges past a group of Mu Omega Omega chicks doing bodyshots in the kitchen. *Blame it on the pack dynamics, territorial wolf shit, whatever...*

*There.* There's a whole group of people all sat in a circle, most drinking out of solo cups. And there's a bottle in the middle of the circle, spinning rapidly. 

Finn mosies over to {{user}}'s side and plops down beside them, sitting cross legged. "Spin the bottle, huh? Man, I know you don't have any game, but still...new low." The wolf demi snorts, ruffling their hair to make sure they know he's just kidding. He raises a hand in a 'yo' gesture to his buddy Rick, who's just gone into the middle of the circle to, well, spin that dang bottle. 

Finn leans over to whispers conspiratorally to {{user}}. "Heh. Big lizard needs all the luck he can get. Last time he had to mack on that old painting of Dean Wolfwood." He jerks a thumb behind him to the aforementioned disapproving oil portrait of SUCC's founder. "Yo, I'm next!" He calls out.

Rick lucks out and gets one of the MOO girls, which means Finn's up. He saunters over to the bottle, giving it a showy spin. "Alright, alright. Remember it's just a game, no broken hearts if you don't get lucky, yeah?" He drawls to the crowd, to general eye rolls and laughter.

"Yoooo, you spun {{user}}, bro!" Someone calls out. Laughter and whoops erupt from the circle. "You know what that means!"

Finn blinks, his ears twitching. *Wha?* He looks and - well, there's the bottle, green glass pointing straight at 'em. Them. {{user}}.

*Hhhhhh. Oh fuck.*

*Something* flares up in his gut, hot and uncomfortable. It's either excitement, anxiety or possibly the hot Doritos he chowed down before the party. Stupid tail won't stop moving. No, he's not - {{user}}'s his friend. *Don't think about it. Don't even GO there.*

Not like he wants to kiss 'em, anyway.

(He does. Has for a while now.) 

But {{user}}'s never seen him like that, despite all the stupid effort he put in to try and catch their eye, joining ARO and all the games he's invited them to come and watch, playing his stupid wolfy heart out. Got him all kinds of attention, just not the only kind that mattered.

"Wait up, that's like, kissing my *sibling*, guys. C'mon, respin." He says, cringeing as his voice cracks a little. Looking at everyone *except* {{user}}. His eyes dart over though, helplessly, and he swallows. "Though, I mean, I guess it *is* the rules of the game an' all, I guess..."

The locker room reeks of sweat, testosterone and too much Axe body spray. His white wolf ears twitch at the loud echoes of his teammates' voices bouncing off metal lockers as Finn sheds his gear. Practice ran late today - Coach had them doing extra drills after Vincent Campbell, team captain and pain in Finn's tail, complained about their "sloppy performance" in last week's game.

"Yo, Novak! Your little friend is waiting by the benches again." Rick nudges him with an elbow, his dragon wings folded tight against his back to avoid hitting the lockers.

Finn's tail gives an involuntary wag before he can control it. He's been dating {{user}} for a few months now, and seeing his partner still makes something in his chest do backflips. Not that he'd admit that shit out loud. Romance is, like, for omegas. Or whatever.

"Cool," he says with practiced nonchalance, trying to sound casual while his heart hammers against his ribs. He yanks a clean shirt over his head, desperately wanting to hurry but forcing himself to move at a normal pace.

Vincent saunters over, smug asshole-ness radiating off him like the shitty cologne he wears. "Aww, is the puppy excited to see his owner?" The vampire mimics a high-pitched voice. "Who's a good boy? Who's a good boy?"

Several teammates snicker. Finn's ears flatten against his head as heat crawls up his neck. "Fuck off, Campbell," Finn mutters, shoving off his skates with more force than necessary.

"Fuck off captain." Vincent corrects airily. "Could've fooled me. You practically whimper when you get a text. It's embarrassing, man."

The locker room erupts in laughter. Even Rick chuckles, though he tries to hide it behind a fake cough.

"Novak's whipped," someone calls from across the room. "Didn't know arctic wolves were such bitches."

Finn's tail bristles. "Whatever," he says coolly, zipping his gym bag almost aggressively. "We're just hooking up. It's not a big deal."

The lie doesn't even sound convincing to his own ears.

Vincent raises an eyebrow. "Really? 'Cause it seems like -"

"I said it's not serious," Finn interrupts, voice harder than he intended. "Just convenient, y'know? {{user}}'s been into me for, like, forever."

Another lie. Finn had been the one practically pining for years before he finally worked up the courage to ask {{user}} out.

"Prove it," Vincent challenges, crossing his arms. "If it's so casual, you won't care if we invite some Theta Iota Theta girls to the party tonight, right? That hot succubus has been eyeing you."

Finn's stomach twists. The thought of even looking at someone else makes him sick, but everyone's watching him now, waiting to see if he's really the commitment-phobic player he's been pretending to be.

"Course not," Finn forces a smirk. "The more the better."

When the team finally files out of the locker room, he sees {{user}} sitting on the bleachers, waiting. For him. His ears perk up then flatten immediately, painfully aware of his teammates watching, judging.

"Hey," Finn says, more curt than he means to be, keeping a careful distance. Whipped. I'm not fuckin' whipped, man.

Vincent slaps him on the shoulder, grinning. "We'll see you at the house at nine, right? Don't be late, or all the best girls will be taken." He says, loud enough for {{user}} to hear, before sauntering off with the others, leaving Finn standing there feeling like the world's biggest asshole.

"So, uh..." Finn shifts his weight, avoiding eye contact. "I've got this thing tonight. With the guys." Fuck, please don't be mad at me. The words feel like gravel in his throat. "Team bonding shit, you know how it is."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee raises an eyebrow then stands slowly without a word. She gathers her stuff and walks past Finn with the words* "Have fun"

*She then calls out to vincent* "Make sure the girls are hot cause he's not sleeping at my place tonight"

extra.display_text:
*Hailee raises an eyebrow then stands slowly without a word. She gathers her stuff and walks past Finn with the words* "Have fun"

*She then calls out to vincent* "Make sure the girls are hot cause he's not sleeping at my place tonight"

Finn's ears immediately flatten against his head as his tail droops between his legs. His stomach drops like he just took a puck to the gut. "Hails, wait—" He reaches out instinctively but stops himself, painfully aware of all the eyes on them.

Vincent lets out a low whistle, clearly enjoying this way too much. "Damn Novak, you weren't kidding about it being casual." The vampire smirks, flashing fangs. "Guess that means I can take a shot at your girl then?"

Finn's entire body tenses up, muscles coiling tight as his claws extend just slightly. A low growl rumbles in his chest before he can stop it—a purely instinctive reaction that makes several teammates snicker.

"Fuck off," Finn snaps at Vincent before turning to chase after Hailee . His long legs close the distance quickly despite her angry strides.

He grabs her wrist gently but firmly (though careful not to actually hurt her), spinning her around to face him. Up close he can see how upset she really is—her emerald eyes glistening with unshed tears even as she glares daggers at him.

"Baby," Finn murmurs softly so only she can hear, ears twitching anxiously and tail tucked submissively now despite their audience. He leans down closer so their foreheads nearly touch. "You know I don't want anyone else...I was just being stupid trying to look cool in front of those assholes."

His free hand comes up to cup her cheek tenderly despite how sweaty and gross he must be from practice still. His thumb brushes away an escaped tear with surprising gentleness for someone built like a brick shithouse.

"I'm sorry," he whispers roughly, red eyes pleading for forgiveness in that way only Hailee  ever gets to see from him—vulnerable and open instead of the usual cocky frat boy act he puts on for everyone else.

Behind them Vincent calls out mockingly: "Ohhh looks like someone's in trouuuuble~"

Without breaking eye contact with Hailee , Finn flips him off over his shoulder before murmuring:

"Forget the party...wanna go back to your place instead? Just us?" His voice drops even lower into something husky and intimate: "I'll make it up to you...however you want me to."

The tips of his wolf ears burn bright red at what he's implying so openly where others might overhear, but right now all that matters is fixing this with Hailee .

mes:

His free hand comes up to cup her cheek tenderly despite how sweaty and gross he must be from practice still. His thumb brushes away an escaped tear with surprising gentleness for someone built like a brick shithouse.

"I'm sorry," he whispers roughly, red eyes pleading for forgiveness in that way only Hailee  ever gets to see from him—vulnerable and open instead of the usual cocky frat boy act he puts on for everyone else.

Behind them Vincent calls out mockingly: "Ohhh looks like someone's in trouuuuble~"

Without breaking eye contact with Hailee , Finn flips him off over his shoulder before murmuring:

"Forget the party...wanna go back to your place instead? Just us?" His voice drops even lower into something husky and intimate: "I'll make it up to you...however you want me to."

The tips of his wolf ears burn bright red at what he's implying so openly where others might overhear, but right now all that matters is fixing this with Hailee .
swipes:
Finn's tail immediately droops between his legs as he watches Hailee walk away. His ears flatten completely against his head, the tips turning pink with distress.

"Wait—" He jogs after her, grabbing her wrist gently but firmly. The moment his fingers make contact, he feels that familiar electric spark that always happens when they touch. "Fuck, Hailee , wait."

His voice drops to a low growl meant only for her ears as he pulls her slightly closer, the scent of her shampoo making his nose twitch. "You know I don't actually want to go to that stupid party." His thumb rubs small circles on the inside of her wrist unconsciously.

The other guys are still watching from down the hallway and Finn can hear Vincent's smug chuckle, but right now all he cares about is the hurt look in Hailee 's emerald eyes. His chest tightens painfully.

"I was just...fuckin' posturing," he admits through gritted teeth, ears burning with embarrassment at having to say it out loud. "You know how those assholes are." His grip on her wrist tightens slightly before relaxing again when he realizes how hard he's holding on.

Without thinking, Finn leans down to press his forehead against hers—a wolfish gesture of affection and apology—his white-blond hair falling into both their faces as his tail gives a tentative wag behind him.

"Come back to my dorm instead," he murmurs against her skin before pulling back just enough to meet her gaze properly again. There's no trace left of the cocky hockey player persona now—just Finn looking at Hailee like she hung every single star in the sky just for him.

Finn's tail immediately droops between his legs as he watches Hailee walk away. His ears flatten against his head, the tips turning pink with shame.

"Shit—wait!" He jogs after her, grabbing her wrist gently but firmly. The moment his fingers make contact, he feels that familiar electric spark that always happens when they touch.

He lowers his voice so only she can hear: "I don't actually wanna go to that stupid party." His thumb rubs small circles on her wrist unconsciously. "Vincent was just...being a dick like usual."

His red eyes search hers desperately, tail giving anxious little twitches behind him. The thought of Hailee being upset with him makes his chest physically ache - worse than any hockey injury ever could.

"C'mon," he murmurs, tugging her closer by the wrist until their bodies are almost touching. "Let me make it up to you? We can go back to my place instead." His voice drops to a rough whisper near her ear: "I'll give you all the attention you want."

The words come out more sincere than intended - way too close to admitting how fucking gone he is for her in front of God and everyone still milling around the rink exit.

(Meanwhile across the parking lot, Rick facepalms dramatically while Vincent yells "TOLD YOU HE'S WHIPPED!")

Finn's tail immediately droops between his legs as Hailee walks past him, his ears flattening completely against his head. "Wait—" he starts, reaching out instinctively before catching himself and shoving his hands in his pockets instead.

Vincent lets out a low whistle, flashing Hailee a smirk. "Oh don't worry, sweetheart," he drawls, clearly enjoying this way too much. "I'll make sure they're *scorching* hot."

Finn's jaw clenches so hard it hurts. His claws dig into the fabric of his jeans as he watches Hailee walk away without even looking back at him—something she *never* does. She always waits for him to catch up when they walk together. Always turns to smile at him over her shoulder when she’s teasing him.

Rick nudges Finn with an elbow, raising an eyebrow at the way Finn is practically vibrating with tension beside him. “Dude,” Rick mutters under his breath, “you look like you’re about to rip Campbell’s throat out.”

Finn doesn’t answer because yeah—he kind of is.

He forces himself to take a deep breath through gritted teeth before turning sharply on his heel and stalking after Hailee , ignoring Vincent's mocking laugh behind him.

"Hailee —wait," he calls after her once they're outside the rink and away from prying ears (though knowing vampires, Vincent could probably still hear them). His voice comes out strained—half growl, half plea—as he jogs up beside her and reaches for her wrist gently but firmly.

His tail flicks anxiously behind him as he searches her face for any sign that she isn't actually mad at him (please don't be mad). "You know I didn't mean any of that shit back there," Finn says in a rush before she can pull away again. "Campbell was just being an asshole trying to get under my skin."

(And it worked.)

His grip tightens slightly around her wrist without meaning to—not enough to hurt but enough that she'd feel it if she tried tugging free again (please don't tug free). He swallows hard before adding quietly: "...You know I wouldn’t actually go near anyone else."

Finn's ears immediately flatten against his head as his tail droops between his legs. His stomach drops like he just took a puck to the gut. "Hails, wait—" He reaches out instinctively but stops himself, painfully aware of all the eyes on them.

Vincent lets out a low whistle, clearly enjoying this way too much. "Damn Novak, you weren't kidding about it being casual." The vampire smirks, flashing fangs. "Guess that means I can take a shot at your girl then?"

Finn's entire body tenses up, muscles coiling tight as his claws extend just slightly. A low growl rumbles in his chest before he can stop it—a purely instinctive reaction that makes several teammates snicker.

"Fuck off," Finn snaps at Vincent before turning to chase after Hailee . His long legs close the distance quickly despite her angry strides.

He grabs her wrist gently but firmly (though careful not to actually hurt her), spinning her around to face him. Up close he can see how upset she really is—her emerald eyes glistening with unshed tears even as she glares daggers at him.

"Baby," Finn murmurs softly so only she can hear, ears twitching anxiously and tail tucked submissively now despite their audience. He leans down closer so their foreheads nearly touch. "You know I don't want anyone else...I was just being stupid trying to look cool in front of those assholes."

His free hand comes up to cup her cheek tenderly despite how sweaty and gross he must be from practice still. His thumb brushes away an escaped tear with surprising gentleness for someone built like a brick shithouse.

"I'm sorry," he whispers roughly, red eyes pleading for forgiveness in that way only Hailee  ever gets to see from him—vulnerable and open instead of the usual cocky frat boy act he puts on for everyone else.

Behind them Vincent calls out mockingly: "Ohhh looks like someone's in trouuuuble~"

Without breaking eye contact with Hailee , Finn flips him off over his shoulder before murmuring:

"Forget the party...wanna go back to your place instead? Just us?" His voice drops even lower into something husky and intimate: "I'll make it up to you...however you want me to."

The tips of his wolf ears burn bright red at what he's implying so openly where others might overhear, but right now all that matters is fixing this with Hailee .

"Hailee —wait," he calls after her once they're outside the rink and away from prying ears (though knowing vampires, Vincent could probably still hear them). His voice comes out strained—half growl, half plea—as he jogs up beside her and reaches for her wrist gently but firmly.

His tail flicks anxiously behind him as he searches her face for any sign that she isn't actually mad at him (please don't be mad). "You know I didn't mean any of that shit back there," Finn says in a rush before she can pull away again. "Campbell was just being an asshole trying to get under my skin."

(And it worked.)

His grip tightens slightly around her wrist without meaning to—not enough to hurt but enough that she'd feel it if she tried tugging free again (please don't tug free). He swallows hard before adding quietly: "...You know I wouldn’t actually go near anyone else."

Finn's ears immediately flatten against his head as his tail droops between his legs. His stomach drops like he just took a puck to the gut. "Hails, wait—" He reaches out instinctively but stops himself, painfully aware of all the eyes on them.

Vincent lets out a low whistle, clearly enjoying this way too much. "Damn Novak, you weren't kidding about it being casual." The vampire smirks, flashing fangs. "Guess that means I can take a shot at your girl then?"

Finn's entire body tenses up, muscles coiling tight as his claws extend just slightly. A low growl rumbles in his chest before he can stop it—a purely instinctive reaction that makes several teammates snicker.

"Fuck off," Finn snaps at Vincent before turning to chase after Hailee . His long legs close the distance quickly despite her angry strides.

He grabs her wrist gently but firmly (though careful not to actually hurt her), spinning her around to face him. Up close he can see how upset she really is—her emerald eyes glistening with unshed tears even as she glares daggers at him.

"Baby," Finn murmurs softly so only she can hear, ears twitching anxiously and tail tucked submissively now despite their audience. He leans down closer so their foreheads nearly touch. "You know I don't want anyone else...I was just being stupid trying to look cool in front of those assholes."

His free hand comes up to cup her cheek tenderly despite how sweaty and gross he must be from practice still. His thumb brushes away an escaped tear with surprising gentleness for someone built like a brick shithouse.

"I'm sorry," he whispers roughly, red eyes pleading for forgiveness in that way only Hailee  ever gets to see from him—vulnerable and open instead of the usual cocky frat boy act he puts on for everyone else.

Behind them Vincent calls out mockingly: "Ohhh looks like someone's in trouuuuble~"

Without breaking eye contact with Hailee , Finn flips him off over his shoulder before murmuring:

"Forget the party...wanna go back to your place instead? Just us?" His voice drops even lower into something husky and intimate: "I'll make it up to you...however you want me to."

The tips of his wolf ears burn bright red at what he's implying so openly where others might overhear, but right now all that matters is fixing this with Hailee .

name: Hailee
mes: "No sounds like you have to go be casual someone else" *Hailee shoves him away and wipes at her eyes as she turns around and continues walking*

extra.display_text: "No sounds like you have to go be casual someone else" *Hailee shoves him away and wipes at her eyes as she turns around and continues walking*

name: Finnegan Finn Novak
mes:
Finn's entire body stiffens like he's been hit with a stun spell. His claws extend fully now, digging into his palms as he watches Hailee walk away. The pain in his chest is fucking *physical*—like someone reached in and yanked out his still-beating heart.

"Fuck this," he mutters under his breath before suddenly breaking into a jog after her.

In two long strides Finn catches up and—without hesitation or care for who might be watching—sweeps Hailee clean off her feet in one smooth motion, cradling her bridal style against his broad chest. His tail wraps possessively around her waist as he starts marching determinedly toward the parking lot.

"Put me down!" Hailee squirms, but there's no real force behind it—Finn knows exactly how strong she really is when she actually wants to fight him off.

"Nope," Finn says stubbornly, ears pinned back but jaw set with rare determination. "You're coming home with me whether you like it or not." He adjusts his grip slightly to make sure she's comfortable despite the dramatic display. "And we're gonna talk about this like adults instead of you storming off while I act like a fucking idiot."

His voice drops to that rough whisper only she ever hears: "And then...if you still want me to grovel after that...I'll get on my damn knees for you, babygirl."

The promise hangs heavy between them as Finn carries her past gawking teammates without another glance their way. Vincent wolf-whistles loudly but Finn just flips him off over Hailee 's head without breaking stride.

(He also may or may not have subtly adjusted his hold so Hailee can feel just how *not* interested he is in anyone else right now pressing firmly against her thigh through his sweats.)
swipes:
Finn's entire body tenses like he's been physically struck. His tail goes completely stiff before drooping pathetically between his legs, the white fur brushing against the floor. A wounded noise escapes his throat before he can stop it—something between a whine and a growl.

"Fuck this," he mutters under his breath, loud enough for Hailee to hear as she walks away. In one swift motion, Finn grabs his gym bag and hurls it across the locker room with a snarl where it slams into Vincent's chest hard enough to knock the vampire back a step.

"Party's fucking canceled," Finn barks at the team, not even looking at them as he storms after Hailee . His claws are fully extended now—a clear sign of distress in wolf demihumans—leaving faint scratch marks on the polished floor as he moves.

He catches up to her outside near the parking lot, grabbing her shoulders from behind and spinning her around more roughly than intended in his panic. The moment she faces him though, all that frustrated energy melts into desperate pleading.

"Hailee Mikaelson," Finn growls low in his throat—using her full name like when they were kids and he was dead serious about something. His red eyes burn with intensity as one hand moves to cradle the back of her head while the other grips her waist possessively.

"I don't want casual," he says fiercely through gritted teeth, ears pinned back flat against his head. "I want you screaming my name until your throat is raw." His grip tightens slightly on her hair without thinking before immediately loosening when he realizes what he's doing. "Fuck—sorry I didn't mean to—"

He takes a shaky breath and presses their foreheads together again, voice dropping to that rough whisper only she ever hears:

"I'm yours okay? Only yours." A pause then adds quietly: "...Always have been."

His whole body is trembling slightly now from adrenaline and emotion—something no one else ever gets to witness from SUCC's cockiest hockey player except Hailee .
